meanings.definition: Subject to one or more conditions or requirements.
meanings.sent1: The approval was conditionally granted based on the completion of the necessary paperwork.
meanings.sent2: She agreed to lend her bike conditionally, as long as it was returned by sunset.
meanings.sent3: The cat conditionally allowed the dog to share its bed, but only if it stayed on its side.
meanings.sent4: His love was conditionally given, dependent on her loyalty and honesty.
meanings.sent5: The contract was signed conditionally, with the stipulation that the project be completed on time.

meanings.definition: Depending on something else being true or happening.
meanings.sent1: The success of the plan was conditionally linked to the weather forecast.
meanings.sent2: Her happiness was conditionally tied to her performance at work.
meanings.sent3: The party was conditionally planned for Saturday, pending the availability of the venue.
meanings.sent4: His trust was conditionally given, waiting for her to prove her sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The decision was conditionally made, awaiting further information before finalizing.
